skill_description: Observe and describe physical properties of everyday materials including texture, weight, hardness, and flexibility.

subskills.DESCRIPTION: Sort objects into groups based on a single observable property (e.g., all smooth objects, all rough objects)
Use descriptive words to compare the texture of two different objects (rough/smooth, bumpy/flat)
Compare the weight of two objects using hands to determine which is heavier/lighter
Test and describe whether common objects are flexible or rigid by attempting to bend them
Use simple tools (balance scale) to compare and order 3 objects by weight
Identify and group materials based on hardness by testing if they can be scratched with a fingernail
Compare and contrast two materials using multiple properties (texture AND weight)
Predict whether objects will sink or float based on observable properties before testing
Sort a collection of 6-8 objects into a Venn diagram based on two properties (e.g., hard/soft and heavy/light)
Design and conduct a simple investigation to test which materials are best for a specific purpose based on their properties
Create and present a "property museum" featuring 5 objects, describing multiple properties of each
Compare similar objects made of different materials and explain how their properties affect their use
